lines.content: Its name is **_Doge_**, a person who occasionally ~~pisses~~ annoys you but at the end of the day, you still love them. You can download me [here](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1awN6tT8uNJPXamfNgMrCKOAhq0H9qMdz/view?usp=sharing)! Below are the instructions on how to use it.
- [x] Able to track different kinds of tasks (Todo, Event, Deadline)
3. **deadline** `return book`/`2022-02-12 19:10`: adds a task with a deadline
1. **list**: generates a list of all tasks
2. **list** `<` `2022-05-20 15:20`: generates a list of tasks that falls before 20th May 2022 15:20
1. **delete** `2`: deletes the 2nd task in the list
- Adds a todo task to the task list.
- Adds an event task to the task list.
- Adds an event task to the task list.

* Represents the "bye" command. Doge bot will send a farewell message and terminate itself.
* Executes the "Bye" command. It saves the current TaskList into storage and then Doge bot terminates itself.
* @throws DogeException if storage fails to save task list
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DogeException {
assert tasks != null : "TaskList should not be null";
assert ui != null : "Ui should not be null";
assert storage != null : "Storage should not be null";
return "Please don't ever bother me again, bye.";
* Encapsulates the functionalities of the different commands understandable by Doge bot.
* @param tasks the TaskList that keeps an arrayList of the current list of tasks
* @param ui the Ui that Doge bot is using
* @param storage the storage to save the list of tasks to
* @throws DogeException if there is a failure in TaskList or Storage method calls
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DogeException;
* Represents the "deadline" command. Doge bot will add a task of "deadline" type into the TaskList.
* @param task the deadline task that is associated with this command
* Executes the "deadline" command. It adds a task of "deadline" type into the TaskList.
* @throws DogeException if it fails to add the "deadline" task into the TaskList or user failed to provide
* necessary details to initialise a Deadline task
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DogeException {
assert tasks != null : "TaskList should not be null";
assert ui != null : "Ui should not be null";
assert storage != null : "Storage should not be null";
throw new DeadlineException("What is the event ABOUT?");
throw new DeadlineException("Where is the END DATE?");
return "Stop troubling me, I've already added this task:";
* Represents the "delete" command. Doge bot will delete a specified task from the TaskList.
* @param s the task no. that will be deleted
* Executes the "delete" command. It deletes the specified task from the TaskList.
* @throws DogeException if it fails to delete the specified task or user failed to provide the task number
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DogeException {
assert tasks != null : "TaskList should not be null";
assert ui != null : "Ui should not be null";
assert storage != null : "Storage should not be null";
throw new DogeException("How am I suppose to delete something without knowing which task?");
throw new DogeException("Are you incapable of understanding what's an integer? Input valid task no.");
throw new DogeException("How am I supposed to delete something that doesn't exist?");
return "I've already deleted for you! You're welcome.";

throw new EventException("Where is the END DATE?");
return "Stop troubling me, I've already added this task:";

* Represents the "mark" command. Doge bot will mark a specific task.
* @param s the task no. that will be marked
* Executes the "mark" command. It marks the specified task from the TskList.
* @throws DogeException if it fails to mark the specified task
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DogeException {
assert tasks != null : "TaskList should not be null";
assert ui != null : "Ui should not be null";
assert storage != null : "Storage should not be null";
throw new DogeException("How am I supposed to mark something without knowing which task?");
throw new DogeException("Are you incapable of understanding what's an integer? Input a valid task no.");
throw new DogeException("How am I supposed to mark something that doesn't exist?");
throw new DogeException("Your task has been marked before...");
return "Wasn't expecting you to finish that task, I've already marked it!";
* Represents the "todo" command. Doge bot will add a task of "todo" type into the TaskList.
* @param task the todo task that is associated with this command
* Executes the "todo" command. It adds a task of "todo" type into the TaskList.
* @throws DogeException if it fails to add the "todo" task into the TaskList
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DogeException {
assert tasks != null : "TaskList should not be null";
assert ui != null : "Ui should not be null";
assert storage != null : "Storage should not be null";
throw new TodoException("So doing NOTHING is a task? doge.task.Task details cannot be left empty!");
return "Stop troubling me, I've already added this task:";
* Represents the "unmark" command. Doge bot will add a task of "unmark" type into the TaskList.
* @param s the task no. that will be unmarked
* Executes the "unmark" command. It unmarks the specified task from the TaskList.
* @throws DogeException if it fails to unmark the specified task
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DogeException {
assert tasks != null : "TaskList should not be null";
assert ui != null : "Ui should not be null";
assert storage != null : "Storage should not be null";
throw new DogeException("How am I supposed to unmark something without knowing which task?");
throw new DogeException("Are you incapable of understanding what's an integer? Input a valid task no.");
throw new DogeException("How am I supposed to unmark something that doesn't exist?");
throw new DogeException("Your task has been unmarked before...");
return "Knew you didnt't finish that task, I've already unmarked it for you!";
